How did #Nepal navigate civil unrest, an economic crisis, political transition and a devastating earthquake -- and still defend itself against money laundering? Read its story: https://t.co/jz143YMJZC #comics #comicbook https://t.co/47JN9xdZdO

.@Lipton_IMF : The Chinese economy is performing well and reforms are making good progress. We just concluded two-week visit and discussed with authorities their development and reform agendas. Our preliminary views are here. https://t.co/44UuJTsjh9 #IMFonChina

Allowing market forces to have a more decisive role in the economy will help drive China’s global leadership in frontier industries such as e-commerce, fintech and hi-tech consumer goods. https://t.co/toL3IG33gt  #IMFonChina
What are the IMF’s recommendations for China? https://t.co/XtKLrvRZsH #IMFonChina https://t.co/Itr6Oiz8Nm

China’s economic growth accelerated in 2017 and is expected to slow down only slightly in 2018 to 6.6%. We welcome the shift in focus from high-speed to high-quality growth. https://t.co/ce9ykADoyV #IMFonChina
Read this real-life story about how #Nepal, working with @IMFCapDev, defended itself against money laundering. https://t.co/4p9el3lz4r #comics #amlcft #comicbook https://t.co/s3ab48YJsW

To sustain growth in the future, #Portugal needs to keep improving skills and education, and foster more investment and saving. Read the statement of the IMF’s annual economic review https://t.co/Hfzf1uYFHG

#Portugal: a job-rich recovery is ongoing, supported by more investment and exports; continuing fiscal consolidation and economic flexibility remain key. Read statement of IMF’s annual review https://t.co/Hfzf1uYFHG
How #digital is #Estonia? Siim @Sikkut says these days they’re registering more e-residents than there are babies being born. Listen to the latest @imf_podcast https://t.co/80aGDiBT5B

Economic hardship can strike anywhere. As the global economy zigs and zags, who do countries turn to? The IMF never refuses the call. In 2017, more than 180 countries worked closely with the IMF on issues important to them. https://t.co/tfkKKXROpP
Opening up to trade and reforming the economy has helped Vietnam lift 40 million people out of poverty over the last three decades. https://t.co/Y8rQof63Fp

Sub-Saharan Africa has made progress improving life expectancy, school enrollment, and infrastructure development. But these gains could be jeopardized if current debt trends in some countries continue – IMF African Dept Director Abe Selassie https://t.co/ZCMXRZKRCd

DMD Zhang: To ensure sustained growth in the coming years, Asia will need to enhance resilience, strengthen monetary policy frameworks and deepen financial inclusion. It cannot take economic success for granted. Read the speech https://t.co/8K8JC4SJ3m #IMFAsia

DMD Zhang in Singapore: Asia’s efforts to build resilience have left the region better placed to resist economic shocks. But some policy buffers need to be further enhanced, and there is still work to be done to ensure stronger defenses. Read the speech https://t.co/RDKjgM7opV

We are now accepting applications for the IMF Innovation Mentorship Program, a virtual summer internship where grad students all over the world can engage directly with IMF staff on cool and exciting projects!  👉 Apply by 6/17/2018.  More here: https://t.co/ReXThftlrw https://t.co/X3Ba66vbED

.@Lagarde: I discussed with President Putin the challenges facing the global economy and #Russia. The time is now to push the reform agenda while global growth is strong. We will continue our dialogue during the plenary session of #SPIEF tomorrow #SPIEF2018 https://t.co/YVzwRbc9Tr
.@Lagarde: #Russia‘s new fiscal rule has set a standard of excellence and should be respected even as #oil prices increase. #SPIEF #SPIEF018 https://t.co/910dMB0RQm https://t.co/hKVPnwfmwW
